Txt_Rename_Message_Start.Text:
I am the humble servant of Appello<--->He who presides over the naming of things.<KEY_WAIT>
<IfSolo(Do you wish,Is there one among you who wishes)> to be known by a new name?<KEY_WAIT>
...Well, <IfSolo(do you,is there)>?<NO_INPUT>

Txt_Rename_Message_Top.Text: I see. And the individual in question is...?<NO_INPUT>

Txt_Rename_Message_NameSelect.Text: So, {WORD}, you desire a new name... What is it that you now wish to be known as?<NO_INPUT>

Txt_Rename_Message_NameDeside.Text: I see. {WORD} will become {NAME}. And you are sure this is what you want?<NO_INPUT>

Txt_Rename_Message_NameChangeStart.Text: Then by the power vested in me, I humbly beg Our Lord Appello to bring about the miracle of transappellation!

Txt_Rename_Message_NameChangeFinish.Text: The change has been wrought. {WORD} is now {NAME}. Appello be praised!

Txt_Rename_Message_AddNameChangeConfirm.Text: Will anyone else be undergoing transappellation today?<NO_INPUT>

Txt_Rename_Message_Finish.Text: Very well. If ever the urge to be named anew should assail you, do not hesitate to visit me here.

Txt_Rename_Message_NameSelectAgain.Text: So, you wish to be known by a new name?

Txt_Rename_Message_CanNotChangeDeath.Text: Hmm, you wish to change another's name on their behalf? This, I am afraid, I cannot condone...

Txt_Rename_Message_Cancel.Text: Hm? You do not wish to change your name after all? Very well...

Txt_Rename_Message_NameError_Ban.Text:
Our Lord Appello has spoken...
And He has decreed that the name you desire is one that He cannot permit.<KEY_WAIT>
You must choose another...<NO_INPUT>

Txt_Rename_Message_OriginName.Text:
So you wish to return to your original name? I see...<KEY_WAIT>
I suppose it befits us to respect that which our parents gave us. Very well...<KEY_WAIT>
{WORD} will once more be known as {NAME}. You are sure this is what you want?<NO_INPUT>

Txt_Rename_Message_OriginNameChangeStart.Text: Lord Appello! Let that which was lost return to us! Let {WORD} become {NAME} once more!

Txt_Rename_Message_OriginNameChangeFinis.Text:
And lo, your name has become {NAME} once more!
Praise be to Lord Appello!

Txt_Rename_Message_BadNameFinalConfirm.Text: You do not fear the ire of the Namer of Things? I cannot protect you from His wrath. Are you sure?<NO_INPUT>

Txt_Rename_Message_BadNameChangeStart.Text: Then by the power vested in me, I beg Lord Appello to bestow the name of {NAME} upon His serv<--->!

Txt_Rename_Message_BadNameChangeFinish.Text:
See! Did I not tell you that I could not protect you from His wrath?<KEY_WAIT>
Now you must live with the name of {NAME} for all time!

Txt_Rename_Message_BadName.Text: {NAME}? Do you mock the sacred institution of naming?<NO_INPUT>

Txt_Rename_Message_BadNameConfirm.Text: You do not mock the sanctity of the name, yet this is truly what you wish to be called?<NO_INPUT>

Txt_Rename_Message_BadNameCancel.Text: Then choose another name, I beg you. Come, {WORD}, what will your new name be?<NO_INPUT>

Txt_Rename_Message_CanNotNameChange.Text:
But what is this? Your choice of name has angered Our Lord Appello! You may change it no longer!<KEY_WAIT>
Not unless, that is, you pay a small fee to appease His ire. Say...{VALUE} gold <IfSing_VALUE(coin,coins)>?<KEY_WAIT>
Does that seem reasonable?<NO_INPUT>

Txt_Rename_Message_PenaltyCancel.Text: Then I am sorry to say that your name will remain forever as it is now...

Txt_Rename_Message_CanNameChange.Text:
Praise be to Appello.
Now, what will you choose for your new name, {WORD}?<NO_INPUT>

Txt_Rename_Message_PenaltyShotage.Text: Reasonable perhaps, but beyond your means. It seems you will have to bear your name a while longer.
